abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Earthquake Recovery Project in the
            Islamic Republic of Iran. The objectives of the proposed
            project were to promote economic recovery through: a)
            assisting Iran in setting up an effective organizational
            framework for managing construction; b) assisting the
            Iranian scientific community in the development of long-term
            measures for seismic risk prevention and mitigation; c)
            ensuring greater efficiency and economy through
            international procurement; d) improving seismic design
            standards in the reconstruction of housing; e) providing
            Iran with a portion of the required foreign exchange to
            finance its Earthquake Emergency Reconstruction Program
            (EERP). The Bank's performance during this phase was
            highly satisfactory. The Borrower's performance on the
            whole was satisfactory. The key lessons learned from the
            project were as follows : (i) concerning procurement,
            although several procurement and disbursement seminars were
            organized at the time of start-up to familiarize the
            implementing agencies with the Bank's procurement
            rules, problems persisted; (ii) the Bank should reflect on
            measures to make funds available as early as possible; (iii)
            care should be taken that implementing agencies are staffed
            with highly capable staff experienced in project
            implementation; (iv) the housing reconstruction process
            using the self-help method was very efficient; and (v) the
            provision of agricultural machinery and equipment to the
            farmers at a price including maintenance cost ensures that
            the equipment is properly maintained and normally has a life
            span in excess of the depreciation period of 5 to 10 years,
            depending on the type of equipment.

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Earthquake
            Recovery Project are: (a) to assist Iran in setting up an
            effective organizational framework for managing
            reconstruction; (b) to assist in the development of
            long-term measures for seismic risk prevention and
            mitigation; (c) to improve seismic design standards in the
            reconstruction of housing; and (d) to ensure greater
            efficiency and economy through international procurement.
            The project consists of the following components: (a)
            equipment and construction materials for housing
            construction and repair; (b) agricultural construction
            equipment and machinery (mainly pumps, tractors and tillers)
            and materials for repair and improvement of irrigation and
            drainage infrastructure and land levelling; and (c)
            equipment and technical assistance for implementing the
            Seismic Risk Prevention and Mitigation Program, including
            seismic zoning, research and updating of building codes.
